title: Boris Johnson’s historic mission is to save Britain from Corbyn and the Blairites
text:
If he can enact his anti-technocratic revolution, he will be remembered in the same breath as Thatcher

It is the tragic, sobering truth that few politicians want to face: only a small minority of MPs end up making any real, lasting difference to the affairs of men and women. Most of those leaving Parliament, even those with household names, will soon be forgotten: the world would have been identical in all meaningful ways had they never bothered and somebody else – almost anybody else – had held their seat.

Even the likes of John Bercow, who doesn’t fall into this category, will have ended up merely delaying Brexit if the Tories win the next election: if so, his long-run impact and that of...
description: If he can enact his anti-technocratic revolution, he will be remembered in the same breath as Thatcher
